message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CY, cs.LG 

This paper deals with the problem of automatic hate-speech detection on social media, which is a common topic in the field of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also uses crowd-sourcing to label tweets, which falls under the sub-category of social media analysis (cs.SI) and data mining (cs.SD). The paper also discusses the use of machine learning algorithms to classify tweets, which is a common topic in the sub-categories of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper discusses the challenges of distinguishing between hate speech and offensive language, which could fall under the sub-category of natural language processing (cs.CY).
